channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Where do tariffs stand? A look at what's in place and what's on pause
item.description: Trump announced a 90-day pause on most country-specific tariffs, but left other duties in place. Here's a look at where things stand and what could ha...

item.title: House approves budget framework, kickstarting work on Trump's domestic agenda
item.description: House Republicans narrowly adopted a multitrillion dollar budget framework on Thursday, paving the way for lawmakers to begin work on many of Presiden...

item.title: U.S. stocks slide again as euphoria over Trump's tariff pause fades
item.description: U.S. stocks fell a day after posting spectacular gains over President Trump's decision to pause many of his tariffs. Now, some of that relief is fadin...

item.title: Jillian Lauren: What we know about police shooting of Weezer bassist's wife
item.description: Jillian Lauren suffered a non-life-threatening injury this week when police shot her in her yard after they say she pointed a gun at them. Details abo...

item.title: 'No More Tears' author discusses Johnson & Johnson's questionable business practices
item.description: J&J recently lost a bid to settle lawsuits that claimed its talc powder products, including baby powder, caused cancer. Author Gardiner Harris says th...

item.title: Unsecured penguin caused helicopter crash in South Africa
item.description: Pilot lost control after bird in cardboard box slid off a passenger's knee and knocked controls, aviation authority finds.

item.title: Senate daylight saving time hearing: "Stuck with this since World War I"
item.description: President Trump suggested in December that he supported eliminating daylight saving time.

item.title: Kenya police fire tear gas during school drama competition
item.description: A play critical of the government was initially disqualified from the competition under unclear circumstances.

item.title: Education Department withdraws from plan to address discipline disparities for Native students
item.description: The Education Department has withdrawn from an agreement to address disparities in discipline for Native American students at a South Dakota school sy...

item.title: Sudan accuses UAE of 'complicity in genocide' at world court
item.description: Sudan's government alleges that the UAE is arming its civil war opponents, which it denies.

item.title: This federal rule helped clear air over America’s most beloved parks. Trump’s EPA wants to kill it
Will iPhones cost more In US because of Trump's tariffs?
item.description: Some analysts say that if costs incurred by tariffs pass to consumers, US iPhone prices could rise by hundreds of dollars.

item.title: 4/9: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser is joined by Kelly O'Grady and Jill Schlesinger to report on President Trump's back and forth on major global tariffs, and their impact...

item.title: House GOP adopts Trump budget plan after conservatives fold
item.description: The vote was initially delayed amid conservatives' concerns about the level of spending cuts.

item.title: Trump’s new energy order puts states’ climate laws in the crosshairs of the Department of Justice
Michelle Obama breaks silence on divorce rumours
item.description: The former first lady says people were wrong to make assumptions that the couple were getting a divorce.

item.title: Apr 10: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: More market volatility expected after surprise tariff pause; Hero dog touring U.S. to raise awareness for animal abuse.

item.title: The 2025 Masters is underway. Here's everything you need to know.
item.description: Scottie Scheffler, Rory McIlroy and the rest of golf's best players have gathered again at Augusta National for the Masters.
